content.question: The map above, showing religious divisions in Europe around 1600, illustrates which of the following differences between Lutheranism and Calvinism?

choices.label: Lutheran areas were more densely populated and urbanized than were Calvinist areas.
Lutheran areas were geographically closer to papal influence than were Calvinist areas.
Calvinist areas were more likely to be influenced by minor sects than were Lutheran areas.
Calvinists were more likely to share a common language than were Lutherans.
Calvinists were more likely to be a minority within a state than were Lutherans.

content.answer: Calvinists were more likely to be a minority within a state than were Lutherans.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
